metadata.title: CVE-2024-0775 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in the __ext4_remount in fs/ext4/super.c inext4 in the Linux kernel. This flaw allows a local user to cause aninformation leak problem while freeing the old quota file names before apotential failure, leading to a use-after-free.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-0775` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1003-oem - 6.5.0-1003.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '5.15.0-83.92').
linux-hwe-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.2').
